author: lukaszrozmej
content:
We were debating internally in Nethermind if we can run eth2:eth1 nodes in n:m ratio instead of 1:1 and we think we can. The only thing we would need to change is to spin up BlockTree per eth2 client and later differentiate them in API (merge API as well as standard JSON RPC API). They could share block, receipt and state database (with each having their own block tree, thus head, thus state root). One more thing to extend would be transaction pool which can be shared only partially, but that's not that big of a deal.

The only problem if eth2 clients would branch a lot our Databases would be bigger than in 1:1 to accomodate all the variations.

author: lukaszrozmej
